job description:
• *Associate Scientist, Prep Room**
  • *Brand:** Est?e Lauder Companies Corporate Departments
  • *Description**
Test Product Management:
  • Manage inventory of all add-on study products and materials, e.g. sunscreens, wash-out soaps/cleansers, etc.
  • Maintain products from study set-up through to completion
  • Maintain product logs
  • Includes archiving and/or destruction of returned test products according to approved guidelines
  • Accountable for all test product inventory for internal and external clinical studies
  • Receive clinical returns for Safety In-Use studies and determine appropriate product diversion to Micro, use-up, etc.
  • Adhere to deadlines for preparation of test samples, devices, test materials, and other products
  • Ensure on-time study initiation and facilitation of interim study visits
Study Documentation:
  • Perform quality control checks of all clinical study documents for accuracy
  • Perform quality control checks of product labeling to ensure proper instructions for compliance support
  • Make recommendations for updates/changes to best support study needs
  • Ensure adequate number of documents (e.g. consent forms, photo releases, diaries, etc.) are available for distribution to panelists on required study dates
  • Create studies in the electronic informed consent program, including uploading informed consent documents, photo releases, and panelist information as required.
  • Ensure on-time study initiation and facilitation of interim study visits
Compliance Management:
  • Test product weighing
  • Analysis of product pre-study and post-study weights
  • Review of daily diaries
  • Report results and escalate questionable findings to study investigator
Equilibration Room Responsibilities:
  • Provide coverage for the Clinical Coordinator as a backup when needed
  • Complete required study-related documents accurately and in a timely manner including enrollment documents and ongoing testing documents, e.g. Informed Consents, Photo Releases, interim visit screeners, and product collection logs
  • Conduct preliminary qualification interviews and assess questionable responses that may affect eligibility for study participation
  • Manage Equilibration Room temperature and humidity monitoring, escalating issues that affect study integrity, and initiating contingency plans
  • Manage the daily panelist work flow to ensure efficient testing schedule and proper equilibration time for all panelists prior to testing and data collection
  • Promote the ethical conduct of clinical research studies by reporting any suspicion of panelist non-compliance or misconduct
Additional Responsibilities:
  • Maintain updated training on all applicable GCP and SOP processes.
  • Perform other duties as required/requested by Supervisor.
  • *Qualifications**
Bachelor?s Degree in Science

Knowledge of basic biological principles as they relate to skin/skin physiology

Minimum 6 months experience in Clinical Research

Extremely strong written and verbal communication skills

Excellent organizational, time management, and project planning abilities

Microsoft Word, Excel, and Outlook

  • *Schedule:** Full-time
  • *Shift:** 1st (Day) Shift
  • *Travel:** No
